author: stsp
msg: Follow-up to r38799: Fix a broken test.
* subversion/tests/cmdline/update_tests.py
(tree_conflict_uc1_update_deleted_tree): This test used --accept=mine-full
and is easily fixed by using --accept=working instead.

author: cmpilato
msg: Make 'svnsync init' accept a --force flag which overrides the sanity
checks ("source has revisions", "source already has svn:sync-* props")
so that folks can easily init (or re-init) a repository backup as a
new mirror.
* subversion/svnsync/main.c
(enum svnsync__opt): New 'svnsync_opt_force' value.
(svnsync_cmd_table): Make 'initialize' subcommand accept --force,
and tweak usage message to explain why that's useful.
(struct subcommand_baton_t, opt_baton_t): Add 'force' member.
(make_subcommand_baton): Init new 'force' member of subcommand baton.
(do_initialize, main): Handle the new --force option.

author: stsp
msg: * subversion/libsvn_wc/adm_ops.c
(resolve_found_entry_callback): For tree conflicts, there are no fancy
automatic resolution procedures. Those only work for text conflicts.
With tree conflicts, we only clear the conflict markers, leaving the
working state unmodified. So throw an error whenever people try to
'svn resolve' a tree conflict with --accept options other than 'working'.

author: stsp
msg: * Makefile.in
(fast-clean): This target was really slow because it ran a recursive
find across the entire working copy (including any svn-test-work data
hanging off it) looking for *.pyc files to remove. So make fast-clean
fast, by only looking for *.pyc files in directories where they are
currently occuring. We may have to amend this target in the future
if additional locations of *.pyc files show up, but I'd rather do this
once a year than wait 5 minutes every time I run make clean.

author: hwright
msg: Merge r38616, r38617, r38619, r38649 from trunk:
Fix several missing and extra whitespace issues, mostly in the Windows
specific code of the test framework. r38649 makes previously hidden command
output visible when a command fails with a segfault.
Justification:
Makes diagnosing test errors a lot easier on Windows
Votes:
+1: rhuijben, pburba
